website_summaries.verdict: Although the Motorola Moto G with 4G LTE is a bit pricier than its 3G-only sibling, it still has one of the best displays in the budget arena, its processor makes operation enjoyably smooth and its rounded, compact body is both comfortable and attractive. If you're after an affordable all-round entrance into the high speeds of 4G, you've come to the right place.
pros: The Motorola Moto G has one of the best screens you can get for the price, plenty of power for the everyday essentials, an easy to use, near-stock version of Android KitKat and the addition of 4G LTE and expandable storage are extremely welcome
cons: The camera isn't up to anything more than the odd snap in good lighting, and the addition of 4G LTE means its once "unbelievable bargain" price is now only "good value"

customer_reviews.title: This is not the US 4G LTE version!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE. This product is advertised as LTE, but it really the Global GSM version of the phone. This phone is DOES NOT operate on 4G LTE networks in the United States. Motorola does make a US 4G LTE version, (my wife has one) this is not it, despite the product description. The system settings on my phone indicate it is for the EU market. The manuals were also in French only.
customer_reviews.author: farmfreshk

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket-size phone that works with Net10
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this phone (XT1045 / Peregrine) for more than three years and still really like it. I've only relegated it to backup status because of limited internal storage (only 8 GB). Still it's great for travel, and in terms of speed it's the equal of my newer, larger primary phone. Those who like to tinker with their phones by rooting and upgrading to alternate ROMs will appreciate that this Moto G still has an active community of developers on the XDA website, where you can upgrade your Android OS months (years?) before Motorola gets around to sending it to you. It also works flawlessly with Net10, which runs on the AT&T network.
customer_reviews.author: Q Johnson

customer_reviews.text: While this phone works ok.. READ THAT AS JUST ok......... It is nowhere near as good as what I had. From a Samsung 3 to this Moto 3 is definately a HUGE step down. The phone is way more difficult to use as a phone.. It is hard to answer the stupid thing if any other screen is open, if the phone is in sleep mode. etc... the text messages so far will not allow any pics to go through... the only real good thing is the battery lasts a good time... otherwise I am so far NOT happy with this replacement. Perhaps i need to adjust .. but ..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price, great phone.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Nexus 4 with Moto G LTE. It does all the basics well. Phone calls are clear, speaker phone works great, and screen smaller than Nexus 4 but its sharp. The big plus for me is the battery life. Normally, my Nexus 4, if I don't charge it at night, it's dead the next day. Moto G has more than half charge left. Also, the LTE is faster with my tmobile service. As far as drawback, the camera is so so. However, Nexus 4 camera is not great either. I checked out Nexus 5 at the store, and that seems too big for my use. I usually carry my phone on my front pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Tirso Cruise

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: I received my Moto G 4G LTE phone yesterday and my preliminary experience has been excellent. As one who has owned iPhone 4S, Nexus 5 and Nokia 925 (thanks to pre-paid T-Mobile), I think this Moto G strikes a good balance between value, performance and size. I am not a fan of large phones or 'phablets' and the Moto G is just the right size. The phone feels vastly superior in terms of build quality compared to Nexus 5. On T-Mobile LTE, I have measured download speeds in excess of 20 Mbits/sec! If you need an Android device without any strings attached or bloatware loaded by carriers, choosing the Moto G will make you very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for lots, but bad use of RAM in Android 4.4.2
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling around and choosing your own carrier, as it supports a lot of frequencies around the world. Great battery life and water resistance. Used it in a tropical storm with no problem and battery can last a few days with minor use. With Android 4.4.2 it does have some VERY irritating problems with its RAM usage, often crashing background tasks (like music) if you open some other app. Even while using the browser, I've had the keyboard crash and refuse to start back up, making it impossible to type anything for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Android Phone From Moto
customer_reviews.text: Very functional budget Android phone. Moto did a good job with this one. Most phones at this price point are pretty garbage. Can you overload this thing with too many precesses? Sure. But as far as features and quality it is very polished and refined. Used this phone for a long time. It also has pretty dang good battery life. It doesn't have the performance of $400+ smartphones, but of course that's why it's half the price. Serves me still as a back up phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Best phone you can get under $700.
customer_reviews.text: Best phone I've ever had, stock Android, all the latest updates. Fast fast fast, I play games on it all the time at lunch and it works fine. Beats the mess out of both my old "flagship" phones, a Galaxy S3 and HTC ONE X. Very fast on the LTE, has about the best battery life I've ever had in a smartphone. Screen isn't too big but it's not too small either, just about the perfect size for me. Easy to use one handed, has a nice looking screen too. I don't think it's HD but it still looks pretty good, about the only complaint I have is the camera SUCKS but for this price what do you expect?
customer_reviews.author: Sillycat98

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget phone.(former apple user)
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great. It is fast and the screen is beautiful. The main negative is that the camera is terrible. The images with the stock android camera are bright and blurry. After switching over to a different app the images are far less bright but still a bit blurry. I have switched over from using an iPhone 5 and the transition has been flawless. This item is just as fast as an iphone and the screen is just as nice. I have had little difficulty switching from iOS but users experience may vary based on preference.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: good price point, but the useable screen size is smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: The OS (kitkat) is great. The phone is thinking than I expected. The screen size appears smaller than similar devices because of the design of the bottom of the phone. Phones like Samsung galaxy, HTC, etc utilize the bottom part of the phone (just below the screen) to have a home/back buttom. In the case of the Moto G, the home/back button actually takes up the bottom of the screen . . . effectively shrinking your useable screen size. Other than the screen size issue, the phone works well and is plenty fast for daily "routine" apps.
customer_reviews.author: jephyboy

customer_reviews.title: Major Issues with SD Card.
customer_reviews.text: There is a compatibility issue with some or all SD cards and this phone. I bought this phone because of the SD card slot and happily own a Moto X and love it. I bought this phone to use with a streaming music service and planned to store the music to the external SD. It's a really good phone except for that, but considering I bought this phone for that feature. The SD card is a 32gb Sandisk Ultra. It unmounts after about 2 minutes of downloading data. I tried reformating with Chromebook. No dice. Don't buy this phone until (or if) this issue is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Marko Maikel

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money, not LTE though
customer_reviews.text: I bought the old version of this phone in May and within days, the new one was announced. Thankfully, Amazon let me return the old one and get the new version. The new one comes in a white color option, SD card slot and 4g. I have the AT&T bring your own device plan. I get H+, which I assume is HSPA and about 3mbps download speed. Its good enough for my limited data use. The other addition is an SD card slot. Some confusing articles implied that you cannot move apps to SD card. I tried, and I definitely can move apps to the SD card. The remaining features are similar to the old version.
customer_reviews.author: ht7

customer_reviews.title: That that, Global Carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Take that, Global Carrier! Instead of buying a $649 replacement for both my husband and myself because our defective LG phones didn't even last a year of our two-year contracts, I purchased one of these for each us to get us by. Although not as fancy as our previous phones, this model gets the job done. We have been using them for eight months, and we haven't had any major issues. Small storage was a bit a bummer, but I am still smiling knowing that I saved a thousand dollars by going this route vs. having to buy from the carrier. I may buy unlocked phones from here on out!
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: it is sufficient of single tasks like navigation. Reception is better than any phone I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke a fragile nexus 4 and decided to buy this. While the ram on this is largely insufficient for multitasking, it is sufficient of single tasks like navigation. Reception is better than any phone I've had before, which I took for granted before. Now that I can actually get higher than analog signal in the sticks and hop on 3G/LTE befoe I even cross city limits, I see how important this is. This particular model has a gyroscope and accelerometer, so you do get photosphere and other features that require it. This is a step up from the 2013 Moto G.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Dumped VZW droid and couldnt be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Works great on ATT and i get excellent LTE speeds no matter what. VZW LTE is a JOKE in comparison. I Actually get phone and data service at home now! Vzw phone never got more than 1 bar, had to stand in one special spot of the house to get signal and it wasnt the phone. This phone works everywhere without issue. I lve only a few miles from VZW SoCal infrastructure facility and got the WORST service. No idea where ATT celltowers are but they're placed better than vzw towers in my area ;) also cut bill in half for SAME level of service
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Klick

customer_reviews.title: Does what I want pretty well (including working with the 64GB microSD card after ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what I want pretty well (including working with the 64GB microSD card after reformatting in the phone), i.e. the usual phone stuff plus podcasts. I wish it had more RAM though. I think it can get a little laggy when going to the home screen and switching between apps, but generally performs well enough for the money, especially since I got it on a lightning deal. Combined with the Motorola Grip Shell and a little extra sticky urethane adhesive material on the back for more grip and it's great in the hand and on slightly slanted hard, slippery surfaces like a keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.author: Vidiot

customer_reviews.title: Great Mid-Range Phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice mid-range phone, verging on a top-of-the-line phone. The quad-core processor is really strong, the HD screen is really sharp at all angles and is easily seen in direct sunlight. The battery lasts all day, if not longer. This phone is compatible with all GSM providers in North America. It fits comfortably in my hand and has a really solid feel to it; it's the perfect size for one-handed use, and fits well in my pocket. The pictures it takes are okay but not necessarily the greatest on the market. I'm really happy with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Popquiz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone without considering it's affordable price. So....
customer_reviews.text: Came into Android Ecosystem thru this phone. It is a great device running an even greater op-sys. LTE/4G is not yet here, in Argentina, but memory storage demand is everwhere. The SD-card slot made the difference, now bridged by its introduction in Moto g 2014. I have big hands and, as many others, have some taste for phablets. That means, Moto X 2nd Gen and, then, Nexus 6 are moving my rudder towards them. Once cold and rational..this phone is just a very good one, for those who prefer not to ring with a cell phone almost as big as a washing table. (one thing...sooner or later..I'll do).
customer_reviews.author: David Burden

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer with the Moto G 4G LTE unlocked!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone with all the features of more expensive smartphones. From day one out of the box, this phone has worked perfectly. The camera is not as good as in my previous phone, but I have a digital camera that is better than any phone camera. Camera phone is fine if needed to use it in a pinch for photos. The screen is clear and easy to read. I have recommended this phone to others looking for an unlocked phone.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGal

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, got another for myself.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my wife as a present. I like it so much I got one for myself. This Universal 4G LTE - Unlocked version is top notch! No annoying carrier installed software, just pure android. The screen is unbelievably clear and vibrant, but best of all it's Gorilla Glass which is nearly unbreakable. When you install the micro SD card, it is seamless, the phone treats it like it's own. With Qaulcom's Snap Dragon quad processor, it's super fast too. Only down side? None!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G.

customer_reviews.title: Could have been four stars. Then one day, 13 months after purchase, it simply wouldn't boot
customer_reviews.text: Might have got four stars, had it not died 13 months after being put into service. This is a good size for a phone, if you don't like the recent trend toward phablets. The camera is substandard and the screen is on the dim side. Also, the phone us somewhat underpowered. But it's got an SD card slot and it's durable. Well, that is, until one day when it simply wouldn't turn on. Personally, I think 13 months is not enough service. This one hasn't been abused. But it also cannot be made to boot up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Messinger

customer_reviews.title: the phone is fast and looks great! I've got more storage than I can ever ...
customer_reviews.text: My first Android phone coming from an iPhone 4. I used a Straight Talk SIM and getting 4G LTE on AT&T's network. It's miles ahead of my old iPhone. I'm loving the pure Android OS, the phone is fast and looks great! I've got more storage than I can ever use with the memory card slot. Not sure how I made it this long without a good Android. :) Anyway, research online, watch reviews, etc. You'll find that this little phone is quite nice even along side much more expensive flagships. You won't find a better phone for less money, period. Not even close.
customer_reviews.author: EndUser

customer_reviews.title: incompatible with sandisk ultra 32gb microsd!
customer_reviews.text: love the phone so far but it's compatible with a sandisk ultra 32gb microsd. i tried everything to get it to work. i am not the only one with this issue. i switched to a samung 16gb microsd and now everything is fine. this is pretty lame because i bought that sandisk just for this phone. now i have to return it and settle more a smller capacity. hopefully motorola can release a firmware to fix this?
customer_reviews.author: M. Luu

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the #1 smartphone in the world, with the best relation price/quality. Full google experience, with no modified UI, no foreign apps, complete android stock - all original! All google apps included, even the camera and the keyboard are fully Google made! Try it, I recommend to everyone who want to feel a full android experience, no lags, no worries, no headaches, JUST SIMPLE & BRILLIANT LIKE A CHARM! Thank you Motorola for creating this amazing phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: G, that's a good phone
customer_reviews.text: It's tadd too hefty, but certainly not a phablet. Lacks NFC, but sports Bluetooth. For the price, the G is a good choice for a PAYG plan. It feels good in hand, and looks okay as far as black-slab phones go. Call quality is acceptable, and the screen is bright enough for sunny-day outdoor use. It has SD card storage, which, when paired with a third-party player, turns the G into a perfectly acceptable 32 GB mp3 player. Buy one.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Frank

customer_reviews.title: I don't want a screen larger than 5 inches so this was one of the best android options
customer_reviews.text: This is my Nexus 4 replacement and it's exactly what I needed. For only $200 it's a total steal and the specs still make it a phone worth using. I don't want a screen larger than 5 inches so this was one of the best android options. Motorola's add on's are harmless and could be useful. The audio range and quality is a step down from the N4 with headphones, but the speaker is better. Camera, screen, OS are on par with the Nexus 4. If I had the $ I would opt for a Moto X or Nexus 5 but in this price range this is the best phone you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morris

customer_reviews.title: Really!?
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this phone because I heard great things from it. After having it for a week I'm going to have to return it because it turns restarts out of nowhere at least once a day. The battery doesn't even last me half a day and I'm not a heavy user at all. I'm thinking maybe I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: ELC

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend MotoG to a friend
customer_reviews.text: I got this second one new for my wife. It was very easy to set up and was immediately upgraded to android 4.4. Google downloaded the apps she had on her old smart phone and Motorola migrate moved the message history and pictures. While I could activate the new sim card from my carrier on line, it took a phone call to customer service to get LTE data working. I have been using mine for six months and love it. Super performance for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: WATCH OUT! BATTERY LIFE IS BAD!!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!! I purchased this product two months ago and already the battery does not recharge. I tried returning it but Amazon has a 30 day return policy for this particular product. And so, I did not qualify. The phone stopped charging around the 60th day. Stay away from this phone. Spend a few more dollars and get a quality phone with a quality battery and with longer warranty. The phone does the job, but it is slow and quirky. definitely not use to it if you are accustomed to apple or even samsung phones. But hey, if you lose it at some club or get robbed in Brasil, it is a great phone to have around
customer_reviews.author: grant kwok

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Motorola screwed a lot of people with this phone. Doesn't work in US on LTE. Can't unlock bootloader. Basically a $200 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: maxtadon

customer_reviews.title: awesome and cheap my kind of device
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot I am using it now to keep me fit as well as it has blue tooth smart allows me to connect my heart monitors to it also is not hard to learn how to use it is quite intuitive, I like it a lot, originally I was disappointed, as I was having trouble connecting my outlook contacts with my new android phone, but after that little hiccup I really like my new phone
customer_reviews.author: wildfox

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone with a crummy camera
customer_reviews.text: It's a okay phone. The 8 GB of memory is misleading - only about 3.5 to 5 GB are available to use because of the default Google apps. The default apps cannot be moved to external SD memory to free up phone main memory. The camera is horrible: images at full size look like oil paintings. At full resolution, image details are lost, rendered as color smudges. Buy this phone for the cell service, not the camera.
customer_reviews.author: JamesTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone, Packaging questionable.
customer_reviews.text: Had the phone for two months and it is great. Good value. Disappointed that it was shipped with only a French operating manual and a "universal" charging plug/cable. Plug is bulky. Went on-line and got English manual but not sure why they shipped to Arizona as if it was going to France. Added a 32G data card so there is lots of room for tunes. Other than the shipping issues, I am happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Thrall

customer_reviews.title: MOTO G LTE
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little phone, it does a lot for the price. UPDATE: 2016 Even though this phone is outdated by now, it is still working well and has received some serious punishment. The only downside is that the SIM TRAY PINS BROKE. I cant find the spare part on Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Adolfo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Droid phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. I have been using for 3 months since my IPhone died. I have researched a ton of phones and did not want to invest too much in a phone that I may get rid of (if I didn't like the Android OS). So far this phone has been stable. Nice that it takes a SDHD card for extra storage. Not the fastest processor, but it was also less than half the price of new droid phones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable phone for an unbelievable price!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this phone in black and I got it in white. We love our phones. Can't believe it took us this long to get smartphones, but it did. Thank goodness the rates have gone down on plans from where they use to be.So its more affordable now. These phones do EVERYTHING anyone could ever want. They are not Samsung S5's but I can't imagine they are that much better than these Motorola's......for the price!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: lynngamm

customer_reviews.title: Love Love loooove this phone
customer_reviews.text: So far , I absolutely Love this phone. I previously owned a Samsung mini S3 and I was a little sceptical about this one bit it fullfilled my expectations. Good design, nice camera and it's a light, fast phone. bad things:-does not come with a charger, just the USB cable so you will have to buy an adapter to charge the phone with energy. -does not include earphones. -Not so much internal memory, but it can be fixed with a SD Card
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Silva Gil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone. The screen is very sharp and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone. The screen is very sharp and the microphone is clear. While this is my first smart phone, I have a Nexus 7 tablet at home - so I am very comfortable with this phone. I am thrilled that I can use my wifi to access data at home. This is when I do my downloading and video chatting. This is working out better than I expected. I was a little disappointed that the phone did not include a headset. Oh, well.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Terrific phone!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this (the US GSM version) up to use on Cricket and it works perfect. I took it out of the box, slipped in my sim card and I was off and running. Within a day I was prompted to update to lollipop, which I did. I do get LTE speeds on Cricket with this phone. Yes, this phone does have a sdcard slot.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: A top contender, even in 2015. Only 3G holds it back.
customer_reviews.text: In the top phones of 2014. There are few phones made in 2014 that can be 3G but still make such a buzz, and the "new' Moto G is one of them. The larger screen makes a big difference for some, but the price for an unlocked GSM phone with these specifications is unparalleled. I'd probably even recommend it over a Nexus 4 for many people, simply because of that phone's fragility.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Phone (2nd Generation)
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic phone for mid level price. I gave it 5 stars even though I could not keep it. Just a Note for your benefit: My condo unit has solid concrete fire walls that stop any signal from being received anywhere inside my home. I had to change to a more expensive phone that has a WiFi Calling feature so I could switch it over to my Fios wireless router while in my home.
customer_reviews.author: BigXor

customer_reviews.title: an absolutely amazing phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: the first thing that concerns me about the phone was the fact that had a non removable battery. But I'm here to tell you the battery lasts long enough if you use it wisely until you get home. Or until you can get to a charger....for the price this phone is absolutely unbeatable.....truly worth your money for me this phone works better than my $700 Samsung galaxy note 3 phone......
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: Snappy Phone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice phone, so snappy everything actions immediately. Crisp clear picture with nice color rendition. Cellular signal sensitivity is not as good as my original Samsung galaxy but it is still OK in my spotty area. I would recomend it to my friends for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Howes

customer_reviews.title: after 3 + years
customer_reviews.text: Originally, this was an exceptional phone and I raved about it in a review here at Amazon. I have since upgraded and passed this phone onto my aunt. Connectivity is now an issue along with the limited memory (8gb) making it less usable today. This phone will be retired soon after upgrading her to the Moto G5 Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Bobrapp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cell phone.  Excelente teléfono celular.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cell phone. Easy to set up. The manufacturer installed a few custom applications but all very useful. Very good coverage. Fast. Updated with the latest in Android. Very highly recommended. Excelente teléfono celular. Fácil de configurar. El fabricante instala unas pocas aplicaciones personalizadas pero todas ellas muy útiles. Muy buena cobertura. Rápido. Actualizado con lo último en Android. Muy muy recomendado.
customer_reviews.author: Miguelito

customer_reviews.title: Pay a little extra and get something you can use for 2-3 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. Must say I am very disappointed. The processor is slow, camera is mediocre. And this was after 6 months of use. It is even slower now, if that is possible at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shant

customer_reviews.title: It's halfway through 2015 and the phone still works great. Im not glued to it 24/7 but I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's halfway through 2015 and the phone still works great. Im not glued to it 24/7 but I trade my stocks, check my emails, buy stuff, browse, check weather and use GPS. I think they have a 1 yr warranty through Motorola. My battery went bad. Motorola sent me a new one free of charge. FYI don't use it while charging, that's what kills the battery.
customer_reviews.author: iron_dan63

customer_reviews.title: Great vs Price!
customer_reviews.text: I like this, specification for the price is great, but there's problem which haven't been fixed yet by Motorolla, this phone doesn't work with 32GB MicroSDHC Class 10 (although the spec tells you that it'll work and compatible with all SD card classes!) I have tried 4 different SD card brands class 10 but non of them worked! you can buy this and use class 6 and below SD card or wait for Motorolla to fix the issue with class 10 SD cards.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is the best phone you can get for the money right now. Nothing fancy, it just works. Not super speedy, but no lag. Screen is bright and readable but not the absolute best that you might find on a $600 phone. Battery lasts all day with moderate use (a little gaming, messaging, calling, web browsing, with both WiFi and LTE on). Make sure to get an SD card if you plan to install more than 15 apps or so... The LTE on this phone is fast too, faster than my home internet, which is already pretty good. Overall, a really good phone for a really price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weaver

customer_reviews.title: and I bought the SD card that Amazon recommended, and it doesn't work on this phone
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars is harsh, but my phone did not come with 4.4.4 as advertised, and I bought the SD card that Amazon recommended, and it doesn't work on this phone. Otherwise, a good phone, but with 2 big disappointments. Note: I realize 4.4.4 is causing issues, but it's supposed to fix the SD issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Break away from the expensive flagship phones, and never look back!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second smartphone. It replaces an HTC Rezound on Verizon. I am using this phone on T-Mobile. It is an infinite step up from the Rezound. I'm not sure if I should credit the Motorola hardware or Kitkat more. Together, however, they are brilliant on a budget. Really happy with this phone (and with T-Mobile although that's another review). Forget the $600 flagships, the Moto G rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen MarcAurele

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Picked up the 4G LTE version of this phone to replace my workphone Blackberry. Its much easier to navigate the web and open up / view necessary attachments. Not nearly as fast or powerful as my Moto X personal phone, but for the price and bang for your buck I find it hard to complain about anything, would recommend to anyone looking for a "cheap" yet powerful smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Higgs1

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous phone! I purchased one shortly before release because I had destroyed my iPhone 5 (sorry, the rice trick did not work) and my old Galaxy S (yes, the original) was unacceptably slow and generally unresponsive. For 1/3 the cost of a new iPhone I got one that, in many ways, is equal if not superior. Pay the extra $20 for the LTE capability!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Bad SIM reader
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone and it arrived earlier than expected so that was great. I charged it and started setting up. Got my apps and account all set over WIFI then swapped the SIM from my old phone. No SIM found. I went to the AT&T store as soon as I could to get a new SIM. They popped it in and checked it out. Still not finding SIM. Went though several folks in the shop as well as reading online (says factory reset works, but no). Returning device.
customer_reviews.author: Ortkin

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, but be careful about build quality (volume rocker and side button)
customer_reviews.text: The Moto G is Motorola's best-selling smartphone in recent history. This white LTE unit is an update to the original with LTE capabilities and two color options. The screen is great, the size is perfect, and the phone was fast. My issue with the phone is build quality, specifically with the volume rocker and lock/unlock button. The phone has a very loose as well as flimsy volume rocker, and unfortunately, these buttons could potentially get stuck over time. Better go with the 2nd gen, the better camera alone is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: plexistar31

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck phone you can get
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for buck phone you can get. I use it on Metro PCS, which is basically TMobile. I've gotten 55 mb download speed over LTE before, which is amazing. Twice as fast as my internet at home. SD slot/LTE pretty much make this the moto G version to have. I've had no problems. Looking for to the new android L update.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Very good phone for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: It'a a great phone. You can say a lot about it, but the buttom line : price/quality ratio is great. I'm not a heavy user but for normal use it's working great; I don't know why you would want to pay more for another phone. I'm useing it as a GPS also and I'm super happy about the performance.(I'm stiking with android 4.4.4 for stability)
customer_reviews.author: Cata82

customer_reviews.title: Best android phone on the market - if you don't want a jumbo phone.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I love this phone. There are lots of reviews so there is no need for me to say anything other than it is a great value. If you need a good phone, with great speed - a wonderful screen - and sized right for your pocket - then this would be the best phone for your money. I like it so much that I even bought one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best budget android phone from 2013
customer_reviews.text: Supports T-mobile (not band 12) and AT&T LTE You will need an SD card with this phone due to limited internal storage, with latest update you only have about 4.5GB of space available to the user.
customer_reviews.author: Josh (slayerXcore) Kimble

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price. The Quad Core 1.2Ghz Snapdragon 400 is fast enough for me Pros - good looking screen with vibrant colors and great resolution/DPI -camera is great for a phone - great design Cons -the battery dose not seem to last very long For the Price you can not beat this phone
customer_reviews.author: Edgar F.

customer_reviews.title: Double check your priorities before you buy it.
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 stars it has issues with the external memory, when trying go move data such as applications it gives message that the SD card was removed, so one have to restart the phone in order to clear that. Haven't checked if you try to move pictures from the phone to the SD card, bur it does not happen when when the photos are stored in the card from the beginning. The most important feature on this phone was the expandable memory and the the very thing that gives the most problem. This is the second phone, the first one won't even detect the card.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Garcia-Paniagua

customer_reviews.title: Was running very nicely until I updated to Android 5
customer_reviews.text: Was running very nicely until I updated to Android 5, after that it got really sluggish. Why offer an update that isn't really suited for the phone? Why no rollback option? I ended up selling it.
customer_reviews.author: ihopethishelps

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck out there
customer_reviews.text: I have a $10/month plan so am not hugely demanding of my phone. I rely exclusively on wifi to web surf, etc. and for $200, this phone does all I could ask. I play games, read email, pay bills, take occasional pictures, and will eventually get my playlists on board. I am especially fond of the gorilla glass, which becomes fingerprint-free with a simple wipe across my jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: Great littlel phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for it's price. I bought this for my brother and I haven't heard him complained about it. So I take it that his satisfied with this purchase. I played with it for a bit and it works great. Motorola did a good job with the Moto G. I'm still wondering why didn't Motorola include 4G LTE on the original Moto G.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!
customer_reviews.text: Had it a few days and like it a lot. Good screen, voice calls are good. Even though it's a "budget" phone there's enough here for me. Some things I'm trying to set up are buried but then pocket communicators are complicated. Battery life has been much better than my last phone. So far very good.
customer_reviews.author: Windy

customer_reviews.title: It was working fine the first 3 months but unfortunately last week the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a Motorola Moto G - Universal 4G LTE - Unlocked - 8GB (Black). It was working fine the first 3 months but unfortunately last week the phone turns it off. From then, it does not turn it on again. I have called to Motorola and they told me to star touching the volume down button and the start button at the same time. I have tried several times and nothing happened. When I bought the phone I expected a first class phone, I can't believe that in the beginning of the fourth month it failed like that. I would like to receive a solution for that.-
customer_reviews.author: Pablo F.

customer_reviews.title: This phone is massively underrated. Unless you're constantly using ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone is massively underrated. Unless you're constantly using processor intensive games, you don't need the flagship top-of-the-line phones. This one responds lightning fast in everyday use, and is still small enough to fit in a regular pocket, and use one-handed. For the price, it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Chad and Serra Hadsell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Customer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in June, 2014. I was very happy with it because the features are great. However, it is now August, 2014 and my phone is not working. It all started when I tried powering off one day. The phone seemed stuck because it would not power off. Eventually the battery died and the phone went dead. Today it's just not powering on. I charged it repeatedly and still cannot get power. I'm very disappointed because I have no phone service and I have to invest in a new phone again.
customer_reviews.author: flowegirl

customer_reviews.title: Best entry level phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good phone for entry level users. My Dad is transitioning from a Samsung I9070 Galaxy S Advance. Phone is very quick and best of all, no more Ginger since T-Mobile never updated. It has 4.4.4 Kit Kat. So far, he likes it very much compared to what he had before.
customer_reviews.author: TauVolantis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect phone for those looking for 4G access, but don't need to buy a $600 phone. The phone boots up quickly, has a simple Android interface and just works. The only complaint is the camera is not great, but it is only a 5MB camera on the front. Since I don't take a lot of pictures, that didn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, good price
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a great phone and at a great price, but don't expect it to be super fast and able to handle a lot at once. It only has 1GB of RAM and a fair processor (based on what I've read online) so it's not top-of-the-line. But I still think it's great. Almost no bloatware and a super smooth experience in terms of customization and finding what you need. I got the update to Lollipop also and it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: AbitofAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Budget Phone with Premium Function (mostly)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value and perfect size. Speed is perfectly fine and LTE out competes some premium phones. Camera is a weak point and it doesn't support flash for some streaming content. Not set up for Qi chargingThe new Moto G2 has unfortunately gone to phablet size and doesn't support LTE, so this original LTE model would rate much higher IMO. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim SK

customer_reviews.title: Very OKAY for the price. It did not come ...
customer_reviews.text: Very OKAY for the price. It did not come with an Owner's Manual, so it's been hunt & peck to find features.
customer_reviews.author: Deary Lane

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone for the price overall. One thing I want to point out is battery performance on this device. I'm an average user and I'm getting 1.5 days during the work week on this device. I've had iPhone, galaxy s3 and many other phones and none of them comes even close to the battery performance of this budget friendly phone.
customer_reviews.author: Slashing164

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Phone. Connects to AT&T Towers Using NET10 As Provider At 4G LTE Speeds.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for several months now. It takes a SIM card. I use NET10 as my provider, and they use AT&T towers. I can confirm that this phone is connecting on AT&T towers at 4G LTE speeds. It's a great little phone for the price. It is reasonably fast, and has performed to my expectations. Four stars instead of 5 only because I would prefer the phone had 2 GB of memory, not just 1 GB. I believe allocating more memory would have allowed the phone to better display the power of its quad-core processor. It is currently running Android OS version 4.4.4.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, 5 starts, reasons are quite simple for the same. - Value for Money - Good specs - Quick and responsive - OTG support I bought a wireless charging station separately and it works great. If your camera needs are being fulfilled by another device then this is the best phone to go with. The camera is sub par.
customer_reviews.author: S Desai

customer_reviews.title: The phone worked perfectly in Venezuela for 1 year. ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked perfectly in Venezuela for 1 year. One month ago it stop working, the main card burned, so I had to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Norka

customer_reviews.title: The speed was good, and did not have the usual bloat that ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm impressed with the quality of this phone. I tend to stick with the flagship phone of the day, and picked up this one for my wife. The speed was good, and did not have the usual bloat that most phones come with. I like what Motorola is doing and hope they keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this phone for about two weeks and "so far" I LOVE it!!! Easy to learn. Light weight, slim and not too big but yet, not too small. It wouldn't ship to from the USA to Europe so I had to ship to daughters to ship here but even doing that, I received phone in less than two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Crate of Rummage

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little phone for the price point
customer_reviews.text: So far this phone has been phenomenal. This is NOT the newest version, however - it is 1st gen. I haven't seen a 2nd gen sold with LTE in the U.S. This one hasn't been updated to the newest Android version yet, either. I'm not sure if it ever will - but I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: The phone is comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: This phone does everything I could want it to, has met my expectations and then some. The phone is comfortable to hold, plays the few games I have on it just fine, music, etc. I have had no issues with Wifi or data connectivity and both have worked very well in general since I have had the phone. It also survived water rides at disneyland while still turned on, oops My only complaint is that the power button is located on the side, whereas most phones have it on the top (which I prefer).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Lovely phone for the price w/memory expansion slot
customer_reviews.text: Lovely phone at a reasonable price. It has a memory card slot which I didn't see in the online description. As a result the 4G LTE is definitely preferable to the 16GB 3G model. The white color is also lovely. I upgraded from a Samsung Exhibit II, and there is no looking back!
customer_reviews.author: B. Surkan

customer_reviews.title: Thus is the worst junk. after 6 months of my purchase wifi ...
customer_reviews.text: Thus is the worst junk. after 6 months of my purchase wifi started to get connection problem. If I connect to one home network I never could connect to other home network. I have to do the factory restore. but after one and half year I started to face frequent network lost problem and after two year there is nothing really working. no calls at all
customer_reviews.author: Roshan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone. It met all my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone. It met all my expectations. I will be using it also in South America where gsm is used. Besides I'm not tide up to any contract with any phone company since it is unlocked. I recommend it to anybody who wants an unlocked phone. Hope Motorola will upgrade to lollipop this moto g.
customer_reviews.author: VASCO A. ORDONEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone about 5 months ago and have been very happy with it. The interface is easy to use and pretty responsive. The lollipop update came out shortly after I bought it, which was very exciting as it came with great improvements. The internal memory is not amazing, but for me it's plenty, especially with expandable storage up to 32 GB. The camera quality is decent, and has a flash and a front facing camera. I wouldn't say the camera is much of a selling point though.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Memory Management Bug
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this phone is great except for one big problem - it kills apps FAR too aggressively. And while honestly it's more of an issue to rate the phone at 2 or 3 stars, I'm giving it a 1 simply because Motorola hasn't done a darn thing to contact their customers (many are dealing with this issue) and let them know that a fix is in the works. If you're in the market for a budget phone, this would be a good choice but unfortunately you won't be able to browse Chrome and listen to music at the same time, or listen to music while you use Google Maps because one app or the other will end up crashing.
customer_reviews.author: Jenrac

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone for my daughter it arrived on time. However within two weeks of use the phone started giving problems, the screen went purple and started shutting down on its own. That phone was replaced by Amazon with another one (same make and model). Six weeks later the new one has stopped working; approxmately six "reboot" messages appeared on the screen and within 12 hours the phone was no longer charging and then it stopped working.... though the features of the phone are nice my experience considering the price paid for the phone was not a good one!!!! Clearly it seems they're selling refurbished phones at new phone prices!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Good Ole Standard Phone
customer_reviews.text: Great little smart phone for what I paid for it. Not fancy, camera not outstanding...got good Moto support to higher versions of Android. Probably now, after two years would expect more in a smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Edwards

customer_reviews.title: SD card slot doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first Moto G. This was my second, purchased after my first was stolen. I bought this one with the SD card specifically to ensure I'd have enough storage space. It turns out the SD card slot doesn't work - it doesn't recognize the SD card. From online research, that seems to be a common problem. So frustrating! Other than that, I have loved this phone.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, especially for those with smaller pockets
customer_reviews.text: My wife and my daughter both love it. A fine, good value phone that doesn't require an oversized pocket to carry. Works well on AT&T, and research says that it'll work in Europe too (with pre-paid SIM cards from a convenience store in the destination country.)
customer_reviews.author: Jon E Watte

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. battery last all day and the 4G LTE is very quick. Especially love the navigation for my job. Fits in hand perfectly. By far the best phone I ever had. For a few dollars more I would suggest the Moto G 4G LTE over the original Moto G only because of its 4G capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Sansone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money, compares well with much higher priced phones.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an older family member and set it up for her. From my standpoint as someone used to more flagship phones, GS4, GS5 etc this was still a great phone for the price. I'd have no problems using it myself, just a little more lag for some operations.
customer_reviews.author: B. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This is great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my mom as a replacement for an old LG Optimus L9. I set it up last night and I was very surprised at how fast the phone is. The absence of all the bloatware does make a huge difference after all. The setup was very simple. This is great buy for the price. The camera isn't as good as I thought it would be but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: LZ

customer_reviews.title: Updated worst phone ever battery problems
customer_reviews.text: This phone have an issue with the battery, after a year they stop working, because a battery failure. But that not the issue, the problem it that they get stuck and do not turn on after replacing the battery. Search in the internet of battery problems, Moto G.
customer_reviews.author: Alex CK

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price. It's not cutting edge, but very good with a great screen. My only complaint is that it occasionally drops to H+ data speed and has to be rebooted or cycled to airplane mode and back to return to LTE.
customer_reviews.author: Anyport

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a great phone, and has been working well. The only problem I have is that when I hold it horizontal for texting, the display does not shift. I sometime have to shake it rather desperately :) Reception is fine, so no antenna problems. I have taken photos and videos, and they have turned out very well. Overall, you will like it. Screen resolution is excellent, though it is not full HD. On a screen this size, I don't see a difference. Great phone for the price!
customer_reviews.author: calculus

customer_reviews.title: Responsible seller. The Moto G is so fast. ...
customer_reviews.text: Responsible seller. The Moto G is so fast. It has everything you need in a smartphone. It works with google (google play incorporate). I am from for Venezuela, and it works perfectly with Movistar (3G and 2G) The product does not bring charger and headphones
customer_reviews.author: Maite Franco

customer_reviews.title: I believe I have poor cellular coverage at my home with T-Mobile but phone ...
customer_reviews.text: I believe I have poor cellular coverage at my home with T-Mobile but phone seems to drop and have trouble reacquiring cellular signals more so than my previous Samsung. Otherwise this a great phone and you will be hard pressed to find anything as good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: FL Mtb Rider

customer_reviews.title: The best phone for 100 something
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this phone for already 3 years. The best phone for 100 something bucks
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Kurtev

customer_reviews.title: I thought a brand like Mototola would last a little longer than this.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and great quality. Many uses without the unnecessary expense of other smartphones. Bought another for my wife. Updated 01/04/2016 Sadly, this phone went bad just at one year of use and the other one I purchased failed after 15 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto G (1st Generation) Unlocked Cellphone, 8GB, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe MOTO G has the sharpest 4.5 HD display in its class, all-day battery, quad-core speed and the lastest version of Android! What you’ll notice first about Moto G is the sharp HD display. Its edge-to-edge display stretches to all four corners of the phone. Watch, read and browse on a big, brilliant display. You’ll get a sharp picture and then some.
feature_bullets: Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.

Moto G LTE has an incredible edge-to-edge 4.5 inch HD display. You’ll get a sharp picture, and then some. With scratch-resistant Corning Gorilla Glass, you can use your phone the way you want to without worrying about it.
For extra protection, Moto G has a water-resistant coating protecting your phone inside and out. Now, a little rain won’t stop you from taking a call.
The Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 quad-core processor with built-in 4G LTE, lets you multitask with speed and ease.
Moto G LTE is smart when it comes to the battery, so as you go about your day, you won’t run out of power. Battery- 2070 mAh. This product ships with a USB charger only (no wall adapter included).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,349 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
